newsitem.title: USA: BPA drops Tues peak, firm prices by $1.00/MWh.
newsitem.headline: BPA drops Tues peak, firm prices by $1.00/MWh.

text.p: The Bonneville Power Administration (BPA) offered 200 megawatts of peak firm power for Tuesday pre-schedulings at prices $1.00 per megawatt hour (MWh) lower than the previous quote, the agency said Monday.
BPA offered the Tuesday deliveries at $16.00 per MWh for Northwest sales and $18.00 for California-Oregon border (COB).
BPA also continued to offer non-firm power during off-peak hours ending 0100-0500 and 2400 PDT on Tuesday at $8.00 per MWh for all deliveries.
Non-firm power at hours ending 0600 and 2300 on Tuesday was offered at $10.00, while prices for hours ending 0700-0800 were also unchanged at $13.00 per MWh for Northwest sales and $14.00 for COB.
